name: Cocos Hotel Antigua

reviews.title: Guests are guests not burdens!!
reviews.text: My wife and I were on honeymoon and booked this hotel through Thomas Cook signature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were fantastic, we wanted to stay somewhere more traditional and thats what we got. Lovely little cottages stuck on an outcrop into the sea. The place looked idyllic and the people seemed really freindly.
reviews.title: Authentically Caribbean

likes.liked: — the antidote to the chain hotel

reviews.title: A well kept secret
reviews.text: As our honeymoon continued I found certain things annoyed me especially the restuarant. One night we sat for 20 minutes before taking our orders. (As you have probably seen in other reviews if you are all-inc you have a choice of 3 starters and 3-4 mains with 1 dessert). Some of the staff were abrupt and slightly rude. One night I asked if we could be sat by the edge of the restuarant as we had been put in the middle for a few nights in a row. Helen looked at me like I had asked her to elope with me back to cold wet England!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have been warned - you need to tell them in the morning where you want to sit at night for dinner. Which they dont tell you to do when you arrive.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting... (sub-standard service)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of the hotel is definately the sanctuary of your room and the beach. We stayed in Room 16, quite near the top with amazing views over to Monserrat, Nevis and St. Kitts when its clear. The rooms were rustic and traditional however the only shower was outside on the balcony and it wasnt that private as it looked over another beach. We didnt mind that much but some might.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place
A slice of Heaven on Antigua
reviews.text: We stayed at Cocos Hotel, Antigua for one week in April 2007 to watch the Aussies play cricket in the World Cup super 8 series. Our room was number 5, Premium, clearly so because of its unique position jutting out over the beautiful bay. Food at Cocos was superb - a different breakfast every day, and sufficient choice in the all-inclusive so that we did not even consider the a-la-carte. Staff were friendly, considerate of our needs and smiling happily. The free internet room and well-stocked library were a bonus. We loved the beach bar with attentive service of drinks. Nothing could surpass the views from our room, with 270 degree views. Mosquitos were not a problem as long as we gave ourselves a light spray of DEET. Despite being cricket tragics we can honestly say we were sorry to have to leave our beautiful resort to watch the matches. Thank you Cocos, we will return,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked 4 nights at Cocos last minute and everything exceeded our expectations. It was perfect for what we wanted which was peace and quiet and to chill out completely. The room was lovely and we didn't use the inside shower at all, preferring the outside one. We were in room 9 (standard room) with a view of the pool and beach and next time I would try and get further up the hill looking out over the sea. The food was great, as were the rum punches. It is perfect for a romantic getaway (my boyfriend proposed on our last day) and if you want to be sure you made the right choice just wander along the beach to the jolly harbour resort and you'll be very happy you chose Cocos. On our last night we had the most amazing dinner at Sheer at the neighbouring hotel Cocobay. We were at a table in our own cabana looking out over the sea to Montserrat. I can't recommend it highly enough and it was the perfect end to a perfect holiday. Finally to reassure scaredy cats like me and stop any scaremongering, I saw no spiders or bugs and wasn't bittten once!
reviews.title: Everything exceeded our expectations

likes.liked: — the location, the hammock on the balcony, the outdoor shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a weeks stay at Cocos in Antigua and had the most relaxing time.
reviews.title: So relaxing...
Intimate and friendly
reviews.text: The hotel consists of just 19 "cabins" stretching out up the hillside above a beautiful bay. It's worth paying extra to ensure a sea view as it's a really beautiful sight - enjoy it from your hammock on the balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The birds are entertaining - put some sugar out, or let them help themselves to a sachet from the bowl in your room or the restaurant. Other wildlife includes small lizards, the occasional turtle and the odd (small!) scorpion. Take a good insect repellent to keep the mosquitoes hungry.
reviews.title: Natural and wonderfully different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for 2 weeks for our honeymoon in september 2004 having booked with virgin - was expecting basic with luxry twists - not dissappointed - had superior house, which was right on the tiop the bluff, and despite being the most run down house, had the simply most spectacular views
reviews.title: it is beautiful! rustic chic!! - but v rustic!

likes.liked: — small size of hotel with fabulous setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff are amazing - acari in particular was lovely, the food fabulous and never ending, - i had been nervous of AI as my idea of hell was to end up with a wristband - which you do get at other incrediably expensive hotels on antigua, but here the setting of the restaraunt was just perfect
reviews.title: Caribbean wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you go to antigua go to shirley heights on a sunday evening, its ace
reviews.title: A Little Peace of Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: only downside about the hotel is the lack of security - antigua is a poor developing naion, and visitors shouldnt be to naive about bringing highly valuble watches etc and leaving them in buildings with locks similar to those found on bathroom doors!
reviews.title: Chill out at Cocos

likes.disliked: — Sandflies and lack of air con

reviews.title: Filthy place and unhelpful staff.
reviews.text: that said, fab time, would defo go back - though dont thing uk tour operators use it so much now

reviews.title: Relaxing Honeymoon
reviews.text: We stayed in bungalow 10 during our honeymoon at Coco's. Arriving from St. Kitts we were surprised by the hustle and bustle in Antigua. That all ended once we reached Coco's.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great, the bungalows were lovely (do use the mosquito net), and the beach was the best I have ever been to. You can literally spend hours just bobbing in the aqua water, with just sand, no rocks under your feet.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay at Cocos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say much for the rest of the island since we stayed close to Coco's during our trip, but we did arrange a snorkel trip through the hotel. We were picked up right from the beach, good snorkeling, we saw two sharks!
reviews.title: Needs some serious money and attention!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about Coco's is the food. Wonderful soups, chicken roti's, fish, etc. We never figured out how often we should be tipping though...
reviews.title: Very poor in the end!

reviews.text: One word of advice, we never found an ATM that worked at the hotel or at any of the nearby shops or the casino, so bring cash if you plan on taking excursions or tipping.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!

description: The hotel situated on a bluff overlooking the turquoise waters of the Caribbean Sea is a small, romantic and unique collection of authentic cottages with breathtaking views. A perfect blend of traditional Caribbean architecture and natural beauty set within lush, tropical gardens, this boutique resort borders a secluded white sand beach lapped by gentle waters. The 26 individual cottages have private balconies with hammocks where you can enjoy the cool and relaxed ambiance. The Hotel also provides free Wi-Fi access throughout the Resort for those needing to stay in touch. Other amenities include the Serenity Cottage providing massage and beauty treatments, a wide range of reading material at the centrally located library, a lively beach bar with on site waiter providing personal service to your beach lounger, and use of snorkeling and kayaking equipment. The multi-tiered restaurant set on the cliff is an intimate setting for the daily table service meals including a full breakfast with daily specials, lunch a la carte and specialized dish of the day, and dinner with daily changing three course menu. The views and live music played regularly on evenings throughout the week provide a romantic and memorable setting for dining. The restaurant provides a contemporary mix of international cuisine with a strong local influence, sourcing available locally grown vegetables from nearby farmers’ markets on a daily basis. Fish, freshly caught and individually selected from local fishermen, is a staple on the menu, along with other specialties including spicy local dishes, pasta, tender steaks and classic salads. The staff ensures the highest most personal levels of service, always with the friendly Antiguan smile. The bar offers a varied wine selection, and a wide range of international and Caribbean spirits and beers, and daily rum specials. Cocos Hotel also specializes in destination weddings with an experienced wedding team to assist with every detail ensuring that special day is spectacular, stress free and remembered for a lifetime.
